intro: Lightiodendron licanioides, commonly known as the licanioides tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to parts of Central America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a characteristic known as dioecy. The tree produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
